description: From Latin octōgēnārius (“containing 80”) either directly or via French octogénaire, from Latin octōgēnī (“80 each”) + -ārius (“-ary”), from octōgintā (“eight tens, 80”). Cognate with octogenarian.

definitionGroups.group: (obsolete) Of or related to the number 80, particularly

entries.meaning: Synonym of octogenarian: lasting or aged 80 years; 80-year-old.
examples: […]  he went to visit him, being then octogenary, and very decrepid with the gowt, but had his sight and understanding.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Synonym of eightysomething: a person 80 to 89 years old.
